notes: 8/7/19 GSP - RECEIVED SPILL RESPONSE LTR FROM GRAYSON.  COPY FORWARDED TO SO FILE.  8/22/19 GSP - H-8 FORM RECEIVED VIA EMAIL FROM GRAYSON.  COPY FORWARDED TO AUSTIN.  9/18/19 GSP - RECEIVED FINAL REPORT FROM OP W/PHOTOS AND ANALYSIS.  RESULTS SATISFACTORY.  9/20/19 GSP - CALLED GM, NEED BC FOR CLOSURE.  LEFT MESS.  9/23/19 GSP - SITE CLEARED BY GM, NO VIOLS CITED.

lease_facility_name: CJV-COTTON VALLEY PRODUCTION SYSTEM (CJV BECKVILLE CONV TO GAS) 6.63" PIPELINE - FORMERLY KNOWN AS "BECKVILLE SW LINE"
comments: MRS. RIPPER REPORTED THAT THE OIL/SW MIXTURE HAS TRAVELED APPROXIMATELY 1MI. DOWN HOGGS BAYOU. THE AMOUNT IS UNKNOWN.  OPERATOR REPORTED 1675 BBLS OF SALTWATER HAD FLOWED FROM AREA OF CORROSION FLOWING INTO HOGGS BAYOU DRY CREEK BED.  THEY FOLLOWED THE CREEK BED TO DETERMINE THAT IT WAS DRY AND DIDN'T GET INTO ANY FLOWING WATER.  THEY PUT OUT 2 DAMS WHERE DRY BEDS MEET WATER.
notes: 8/27/19 GSP - INITIAL/FINAL RED BORDER SENT VIA EMAIL BY DRM.  9/10/19 GSP - RECEIVED LOE FROM OP VIA EMAIL.  MAILED SPILL LTR AND EMAILED COPY TO STEVEN SCOTT.  10/31/19 GSP - CONVO W/SCOTT WHO RELAYED THAT SOS ENVIRONMENTAL IS NOW HANDLING ENV CLEAN-UP (CONTACT IS DAVIS EVANS 281/726-4142.)  CALLED EVANS, LEFT MESS REQUESTING UPDATE ON SPILL CLEAN-UP.  11/5/19 GSP - RECEIVED INITIAL REPORT/CLEAN-UP PROPOSAL FROM SOS VIA EMAIL FROM SCOTT.  FORWARDED TO SO PIPELINE IN FOF.  12/6/19 GSP - SITE FIELD CLEARED BY GM, NO VIOLS CITED.  2/5/20 GSP - RECEIVED FINAL REPORT/ANALYSIS FROM SCOTT VIA EMAIL.  EMAILED SCOTT FOR MISSING FOLLOW-UP ANALYTICAL RESULTS.  2/6/20 GSP - RECEIVED FOLLOW-UP ANALYSIS FROM SCOTT VIA EMAIL.   2/6/20 GSP - CALLED DAVIS EVANS REGARDING MISSING SAMPLE LOCATIONS FOR INITIAL SAMPLING.  HE WILL FORWARD INITIAL SAMPLING INFO TO SCOTT, WHO WILL FORWARD INFO TO ME.  2/12/20 GSP - RECEIVED INITIAL & FINAL SAMPLING LOCATION MAPS VIA EMAIL FROM SCOTT.

comments: LOST COMMUNICATION AND PUMP BURNED UP CAUSING THE TANK TO OVERFLOW INTO THE FIREWALL.  208 BBLS OVERFLOWED THE FIREWALL INTO A FIELD.  NO OIL OR CONDENSATE INVOLVED.  1356 BBLS INSIDE FIREWALL HAVE BEEN RECOVERED.   UPDATE PER JL:  1190 BBLS SPILLED.  RECOVERED 990 INSIDE CONTAINMENT..  NO STANDING WATER.  UNABLE TO TEST.
LOAD LINE GOING INTO A FRAC TANK LEAKED CAUSING A LEAK THAT GOT OFF THE PAD.  CLEANUP IN PROGRESS.

MR. JERNIGAN CALLED THE RRC KILGORE DIST OFFICE TO REPORT A SPILL INTO A TRIBUTARY OF LITTLE RABBIT CREEK.  ETSWDC WAS WORKING ON THEIR PIPELINE LAST NIGHT, TRYING TO REMOVE A BLOCKAGE.  WHEN LINE WAS PRESSURED UP, IT BLEW OFF A BULL PLUG AT THE DYERSDALE CLAYTON YOUNG LEASE.  10 - 20 BBLS PRODUCED WATER AND 1 BBL OF CRUDE WERE RELEASED.  SALINITY READINGS RANGED FROM 600 - 9200 PPM.  OP IS IN PROCESS OF INSTALLING DAMS AT TRIBUTARY AND FLUSHING.  THIS SPILL WAS ORIGINALLY DISCOVERED ON 1/30/20 BY RRC INSP SHANNON WATSON, WHO NOTIFIED THE OPERATOR OF THE SPILL.
(MWS) MR. DOAN REPORTED A LOAD LINE RELEASE OF APPROXIMATELY 5BBL OIL AND 38BBL PRODUCED WATER. NO KNOWN IMPACT TO ANY SENSITIVE AREA.
notes: 2/11/20 GSP - H-8 RECEIVED.  COPIES FORWARDED TO FOF AND AUSTIN.
